alert.note: Alert for Anson; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 4:27AM EST until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Rocky River Near Norwood affecting Stanly and Anson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Rocky River near Norwood. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Action Stage. The river begins to overflow its banks in some areas upstream of the gage site. At 20.0 feet, Minor flood stage. There is significant overflow into adjacent pasture and lowlands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM EST Thursday the stage was 22.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 AM EST Thursday was 32.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and continue falling to 6.1 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.0 feet on 11/16/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Rocky River Norwood 20.0 22.4 Thu 4 am EST 9.0 7.7 7.0 6.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 430 PM EST.
